trans-unit.source: Get started with authentication (Android) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with authentication (Android) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your Android app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your Android app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to your Mobile Services Android app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to your Mobile Services Android app

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.
trans-unit.target: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through the basic steps to enable authentication in your app.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through the basic steps to enable authentication in your app.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Restrict permissions to authenticated users
trans-unit.target: Restrict permissions to authenticated users

trans-unit.source: In Android Studio, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: In Android Studio, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: From the **Run** menu, then click **Run app**; verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.
trans-unit.target: From the **Run** menu, then click **Run app**; verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.

trans-unit.source: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the _TodoItem_ table now requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the _TodoItem_ table now requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to the app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to the app

trans-unit.source: Cache authentication tokens on the client
trans-unit.target: Cache authentication tokens on the client

trans-unit.source: Refresh the token cache
trans-unit.target: Refresh the token cache

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In the next tutorial, [Authorize users with scripts], you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In the next tutorial, [Authorize users with scripts], you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
